alert.note: Alert for Harlan; Knott; Leslie; Letcher; Perry; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 7:32PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Harlan, east central Leslie, Letcher, southeastern Perry, southeastern Knott and southwestern Pike Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 732 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Cinda to Speight. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Fleming-Neon, Beefhide, Myra, Speight, McRoberts, Dunham, Hemphill, Lowndes, Ehkhorn Mine and Potters Fork around 740 PM EDT. Jenkins, Shelby Gap, Dorton, Adamson, Burdine and Gaskill around 745 PM EDT. Gilley, Daisy, Pine Mountain, Cornettsville and Ulvah around 750 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Delphia, Ashcamp, Diane, Banks, Totz, Hallie, Gordon, Hiram, Defeated Creek, Skyline, Lilley Cornett Woods, Lejunior, Black Bottom, Louellen, Closplint, Clover-Darby, Cumberland, Lynch, Benham, Clutts, Blair, Kingdom Come S.P., Linefork, Clover, Flint, Kings Creek, Lewis Creek, Partridge, Maggard, Rock House, Clover Fork and Big Black Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Harlan; Knott; Leslie; Letcher; Perry; Pike
